content: Excluding China and adjusted for Russia, global payments volume was up 16% year-over-year and 45% higher than 2019. In constant dollars, international payments volume, excluding China and Russia, was up 20% year-over-year and 46% above 2019. Our three growth engines, consumer payments, new flows and value-added services, all grew revenues in excess of 20% in constant dollars. Constant dollar cross-border volume, excluding transactions within Europe, but including Russia in prior periods were up 49% year-over-year and 30% over 2019. Cross-border card-not-present volume growth, excluding travel and excluding intra-Europe grew 12% year-over-year and was 60% above 2019. Commercial card volumes grew 21% year-over-year and are up 43% versus 2019, and excluding Russia, Visa Direct transactions grew 42%. Constant dollar cross-border volume, excluding transactions within Europe grew 42% year-over-year and was 33% over 2019. You may go ahead. You may go ahead. You may go ahead. You may go ahead.
